P749.label: parent organization
P749.description: parent organization of an organization, opposite of subsidiaries (P355)

P2578.label: studies
P2578.description: subject item is the academic field studying the object item of this property

P509.label: cause of death
P509.description: underlying or immediate cause of death.  Underlying cause (e.g. car accident, stomach cancer) preferred.  Use 'manner of death' (P1196) for broadest category, e.g. natural causes, accident, homicide, suicide

P451.label: unmarried partner
P451.description: someone with whom the person is in a relationship without being married. Use "spouse" (P26) for married couples

P123.label: publisher
P123.description: organization or person responsible for publishing books, periodicals, games or software

P194.label: legislative body
P194.description: legislative body governing this entity; political institution with elected representatives, such as a parliament/legislature or council

P19.label: place of birth
P19.description: most specific known (e.g. city instead of country, or hospital instead of city) birth location of a person, animal or fictional character

P20.label: place of death
P20.description: most specific known (e.g. city instead of country, or hospital instead of city) death location of a person, animal or fictional character

P138.label: named after
P138.description: entity or event that inspired the subject's name, or namesake (in at least one language). Qualifier "applies to name" (P5168) can be used to indicate which one

P161.label: cast member
P161.description: actor in the subject production [use "character role" (P453) and/or "name of the character role" (P4633) as qualifiers] [use "voice actor" (P725) for voice-only role]

P2176.label: drug used for treatment
P2176.description: drug, procedure, or therapy that can be used to treat a medical condition

P641.label: sport
P641.description: sport in which the subject participates or belongs to

P54.label: member of sports team
P54.description: sports teams or clubs that the subject currently represents or formerly represented

P1050.label: medical condition
P1050.description: any state relevant to the health of an organism, including diseases and positive conditions

P159.label: headquarters location
P159.description: specific location where an organization's headquarters is or has been situated. Inverse property of "occupant" (P466).

P131.label: located in the administrative terroritorial entity
P131.description: the item is located on the territory of the following administrative entity. Use P276 (location) for specifying locations that are non-administrative places and for items about events

P780.label: symptoms
P780.description: possible symptoms of a medical condition

P36.label: capital
P36.description: primary city of a country, province, state or other type of administrative territorial entity

P140.label: religion
P140.description: religion of a person, organization or religious building, or associated with this subject

P2283.label: uses
P2283.description: item or concept used by the subject or in the operation (see also instrument [P1303] and armament [P520])

P488.label: chairperson
P488.description: presiding member of an organization, group or body

P47.label: shares border with
P47.description: countries or administrative subdivisions, of equal level, that this item borders, either by land or water. A single common point is enough.

P4552.label: mountain range
P4552.description: range or subrange to which the geographical item belongs

P106.label: occupation
P106.description: occupation of a person; see also "field of work" (Property:P101), "position held" (Property:P39)

P3373.label: sibling
P3373.description: the subject has the object as their sibling (brother, sister, etc.). Use "relative" (P1038) for siblings-in-law (brother-in-law, sister-in-law, etc.) and step-siblings (step-brothers, step-sisters, etc.)

P551.label: residence
P551.description: the place where the person is or has been, resident

P26.label: spouse
P26.description: the subject has the object as their spouse (husband, wife, partner, etc.). Use "unmarried partner" (P451) for non-married companions

P1412.label: languages spoken, written, or signed
P1412.description: language(s) that a person speaks, writes or signs, including the native language(s)

P466.label: occupant
P466.description: a person or organization occupying property

P800.label: notable works
P800.description: notable scientific, artistic or literary work, or other work of significance among subject's works

P2348.label: time period
P2348.description: time period (historic period or era, sports season, theatre season, legislative period etc.) in which the subject occurred

P495.label: country of origin
P495.description: country of origin of this item (creative work, food, phrase, product, etc.)

P407.label: language of work or name
P407.description: language associated with this creative work (such as books, shows, songs, or websites) or a name (for persons use "native language" (P103) and "languages spoken, written or signed" (P1412))

P102.label: member of political party
P102.description: the political party of which this politician is or has been a member

P840.label: narrative location
P840.description: the narrative of the work is set in this location

P264.label: record label
P264.description: brand and trademark associated with the marketing of subject music recordings and music videos

P172.label: ethnic group
P172.description: subject's ethnicity (consensus is that a VERY high standard of proof is needed for this field to be used. In general this means 1) the subject claims it themself, or 2) it is widely agreed on by scholars, or 3) is fictional and portrayed as such)

P84.label: architect
P84.description: person or architectural firm responsible for designing this building

P169.label: chief executive officer
P169.description: highest-ranking corporate officer appointed as the CEO within an organization

P35.label: head of state
P35.description: official with the highest formal authority in a country/state

P17.label: country
P17.description: sovereign state of this item; don't use on humans

P170.label: creator
P170.description: maker of this creative work or other object (where no more specific property exists). Paintings with unknown painters, use "anonymous" (Q4233718) as value.

P57.label: director
P57.description: director(s) of film, TV-series, stageplay, video game or similar

P40.label: child
P40.description: subject has object as biological, foster, and/or adoptive child

P135.label: movement
P135.description: literary, artistic, scientific or philosophical movement or scene associated with this person or work

P50.label: author
P50.description: main creator(s) of a written work (use on works, not humans); use P2093 when Wikidata item is unknown or does not exist

P1303.label: instrument
P1303.description: musical instrument that a person plays

P463.label: member of
P463.description: organization, musical group, or club to which the subject belongs. Do not use for membership in ethnic or social groups, nor for holding a position such as a member of parliament (use P39 for that).

P30.label: continent
P30.description: continent of which the subject is a part

P3095.label: practiced by
P3095.description: type of agents that study this subject or work in this profession

P113.label: airline hub
P113.description: airport that serves as a hub for an airline

P27.label: country of citizenship
P27.description: the object is a country that recognizes the subject as its citizen

P361.label: part of
P361.description: object of which the subject is a part (if this subject is already part of object A which is a part of object B, then please only make the subject part of object A). Inverse property of "has part" (P527, see also "has parts of the class" (P2670)).

P1056.label: product or material produced
P1056.description: material or product produced by a government agency, business, industry, facility, or process

P740.label: location of formation
P740.description: location where a group or organization was formed

P119.label: place of burial
P119.description: location of grave, resting place, place of ash-scattering, etc, (e.g. town/city or cemetery) for a person or animal. There may be several places: e.g. re-burials, cenotaphs, parts of body buried separately.

P1995.label: health specialty
P1995.description: main specialty that diagnoses, prevent human illness, injury and other physical and mental impairments

P457.label: foundational text
P457.description: text through which an institution or object has been created or established

P112.label: founded by
P112.description: founder or co-founder of this organization, religion or place

P37.label: official language
P37.description: language designated as official by this item

P366.label: use
P366.description: main use of the subject (includes current and former usage)

P108.label: employer
P108.description: person or organization for which the subject works or worked

P737.label: influenced by
P737.description: this person, idea, etc. is informed by that other person, idea, etc., e.g. "Heidegger was influenced by Aristotle".

P101.label: field of work
P101.description: specialization of a person or organization; see P106 for the occupation

P136.label: genre
P136.description: creative work's genre or an artist's field of work (P101). Use main subject (P921) to relate creative works to their topic
